items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  9.01
	 
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent, Manny Barbara, Vice President of Silicon Valley Education Foundation, and Rosa De Leon, Californians for Justice 
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Adopt Resolution #2010/2011-17 College and Career Readiness for All
	 
For the past year, the district, through the Board, teachers, staff, students and community, has been discussing the student achievement gap and over all student achievement.  While the district continues to make progress on the Academic Performance Index (API), a high stakes state measurement tool, the achievement gap continues among our Latino students and African American students when compared to other ethnic groups.  More recently, the discussion has focused on how students can be both college and career ready.  The accepted definition of "college ready" is successful completion of the UC/CSU "a-g" requirements.  Alternatively, the accepted definition of "career ready" is the successful completion of a career technical education sequence.  The attached resolution proposes to make "a-g" college requirements as the default placement for 9th and 10th grade students unless otherwise stated in an Individualized Education Plan.  The resolution also memorializes the district's commitment to providing a rigorous academic curriculum and support that prepares students for postsecondary educational and career options.
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Not Applicable
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not Applicable
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees adopt Resolution #2010/2011-17 College and Career Readiness for All.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees adopt Resolution #2010/2011-17 College and Career Readiness for All.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  9.03
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business Services
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Adopt Resolution #2010/2011-18 Intention to Lease District Property for Cellular and Wireless Communication Antenna Purposes
	 
The District has received additional interest from cellular and wireless communication providers to lease property at the district’s school sites and other facilities for the purpose of installing and maintaining cellular and wireless communication antennas.  The Board has previously awarded such lease agreements to carriers Verizon, T-Mobile and Clear Wire.  Antennas potentially would be installed on light poles around the football stadiums at each of those campuses, on rooftops, or as otherwise approved by the District.  Other school districts have entered into such agreements as a means of generating lease income including, most recently, San Jose Unified School District.  
	 
Administration seeks the Board’s approval to accept additional lease proposals at all of the District’s sites.
	 
At the September 17, 2009, Regular Board Meeting, the Board held a public hearing to solicit community input on the potential leasing of District property for such purposes.  Before Administration can fully negotiate any such lease with any proposed lessee the Board must by 2/3rds vote (4 out of 5 Members) approve a Resolution of Intent to lease property and then advertise the notice of the approved resolution locally, including that the District will be accepting offers to lease such property upon minimum rental terms.  Each lease could generate approximately $24,000 annually, or more.
	 
Any offers to lease would be opened and examined at a subsequent regular Board meeting, and any lease agreements would be subject to final Board approval.
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Lease revenue to be determined
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not Applicable
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board adopt the attached Resolution by a 2/3rds majority declaring the District’s intent to lease District property as described in the Resolution.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees adopt resolution #2010/2011-18, by a 2/3rds majority declaring the Districtâs intent to lease District property as described in the Resolution.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  9.06
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM: 
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
CSBA 2011 Call for Nominations for Elected Members of the Delegate Assembly
	 
	 
The California School Boards Association (CSBA) is currently accepting nominations for the CSBA Delegate Assembly.  Any CSBA member board is eligible to nominate board members within their geographical region or subregion.  Boards may nominate as many individuals as it chooses.  
	 
All nominees must submit a one-page, single-sided, candidate biographical sketch form and an optional one-page singled-sided resume (resume cannot be substituted for the candidate biographical sketch form).  All nominations must be postmarked no later than Friday, January 7, 2011.  Faxes are also acceptable, but must be received by January 7, 2011.  
	 
Delegates serve  two-year terms, beginning April 1, 2011, through March 31, 2013.  There are two required Delegate Assembly meetings each year, one in May in Sacramento and one preceding the CSBA Annual Education Conference and Trade Show in November/December.
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Expenses to attend required meetings.
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
General Fund
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommend that the Board of Trustees submit nominations to the CSBA Delegate Assembly.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommend that the Board of Trustees submit nominations to the CSBA Delegate Assembly.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  10.01
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction, and 
Martha Escobedo, Subject Area Coordinator, World Languages
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Progress Update for the New Chinese Language Program
	 
The East Side Union High School District is planning on implementing a Chinese Language Program to serve the Chinese speaking students in the district.  Currently, we have 287 students who list Mandarin as their primary language and there have been a large number of parents asking the district to design a program to teach Chinese.  It is the intent of the district to open a Chinese Language Program at James Lick High School in the Fall of 2011.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  10.02
	 
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction; and Cari Vaeth, Director of Career Services and Adult Education
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Career Technical Education Presentation
	 
A district wide overview of Career Technical Education Programs available to East Side Union High School students.  California Partnership Academies model requirements and funding will be explained.  Presentation will include 2008-2009 CDE assessment data.
items.item_text: Career Technical Education Presentation - Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction; and Cari Vaeth, Director of Career Services and Adult Education

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
                           Item:  10.03
	 
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
					 
				 
FROM: 
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction; and Mary Metz, Medical/Health Professions Magnet Coordinator
								 
SUBJECT:                 
Collaborative Tech Prep Grant Between Mission College and Andrew Hill Presentation
	 
This is a presentation on the collaboration between Mission College and Andrew Hill High School.  This collaboration is designed to ease entry into the Psychiatric Technician Program at Mission College.  Students participating in this program at Andrew Hill have the opportunity to take classes at Andrew Hill and satisfy both graduation requirements and the psychology and sociology course work requirements of the Psychiatric Technician Program at Mission.  This model will be adapted utilizing the existing 2+2 models that feed high school students into Mission's Certified Nursing Assistant (C.N.A.) Program.
items.item_text: Collaborative Tech Prep Grant Between Mission College and Andrew Hill Presentation - Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction and; Mary Metz, Medical/Health Professions Magnet Coordinator
items.item_text_raw: 10.03 Collaborative Tech Prep Grant Between Mission College and Andrew Hill Presentation - Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction and; Mary Metz, Medical/Health Professions Magnet Coordinator

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  10.04
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Approve CAHSEE Local Waivers for Special Education Students - Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction
	 
DESCRIPTION:  
Education Code Section 60851 states that students who take one or both parts of the CAHSEE with a modification and receive the equivalent of a passing score are eligible for the waiver request process.  At the request of the student's parent or guardian, a school principal must submit to the local school governing board a request for a waiver of the requirement to pass the part(s) of the CASHEE on which a modification was used and the equivalent of a passing score was earned.  For the local board to waive the CASHEE requirement, the principal must certify to the local board that the pupil has all of the following:
An individualized education program adopted pursuant to the federal Individuals with Disabilities Education Act or a plan adopted pursuant to Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 that requires the accommodations or modifications to be provided to the pupil when taking the high school exit examination.
Sufficient high school level coursework either satisfactorily completed or in progress in a high school level curriculum sufficient to have attained the skills and knowledge otherwise needed to pass the high school exit examination.
An individual score report for the pupil showing that the pupil has received the equivalent of a passing score on the high school exit examination measures as determined by the State Board of Education.
The waivers were requested by the school site administration on behalf of the students' parents.
	 
The recommended waivers meet the aforementioned criteria delineated in the Education Code 60851:
Student A
Student B
Student C
Student D
Student E
Student F
Student G
Student H
Student I
Student J
Student K 
				 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT
N/A
	 
FUNDING SOURCE
N/A
	 
RECOMMENDATION
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the recommended waivers.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the recommended waivers.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  12.01
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business Services
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Approve Staff Member Reimbursement for Direct Purchase of Equipment
	 
Board Policy and Administration Regulations effective November 2009 prohibit staff from directly purchasing equipment thus circumventing purchasing procedures.  Ms. Irene Perez, teacher at Evergreen Valley High School states she was not aware of regulation restrictions and purchased an HP Laserjet Printer 1536dnf MFP, in the amount of $299.99.  The Printer is in use in the classroom for educational instruction.  The Administrative Regulation does not provide for any Administrator to authorize reimbursement for such purchase.
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
$240.34
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Site Budget
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the reimbursement to Ms. Irene Perez for the purchase of classroom equipment.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  13.01
	 
	 
	 
				 
					 
TO:
Board of Trustees
					 
					 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
					 
					 
PREPARED BY:
Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business Services and 
June Francis Rono, Ph.D., Director of Facilities and Planning
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
					 
Adopt Resolution #2010/2011-18 To Use School Facility Program Funding For Construction of a Multi-Purpose Room at Santa Teresa High School
	 
	 
	 
Consistent with the District’s goal of pursuing all available funding from the State, the administration would like to seek any available funding from the School Facilities Program administered by the State Allocation Board.  As part of the application submittal requirement, the Board must approve the District Representative to file the new construction grant application with the Office of Public School Construction to seek available State funding for the Multi-Purpose Room at Santa Teresa High School.
	 
The District anticipates receiving a grant amount of approximately $2.5 million for this project once approved by the State Allocation Board (SAB) and funds are available for release from the State.
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
$2.5 million in favor of the District
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
State Funding Grant
	 
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended the Board of Trustees adopt this Resolution to allow our District Representative to file the grant application with the Office of Public School Construction.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended the Board of Trustees adopt this Resolution to allow our District Representative to file the grant application with the Office of Public School Construction.

items.item_text_raw: 13.01 Adopt Resolution #2010/2011-18 To Use School Facility Program Funding for Construction of a Multi-Purpose Room at Santa Teresa High School - Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business Services and June Francis Rono, Ph.D., Director of Facilities and Planning

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
		 
Item:  13.02
		 
		 
		 
TO:
Board of Trustees
					 
					 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
					 
					 
PREPARED BY:
Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business Services and June Francis Rono, Ph.D., Director of Facilities and Planning
					 
					 
SUBJECT:
Approve the Purchase of Ninety-eight (98) Relocatable Classrooms from Mobile Modular, Inc. and Williams Scotsman, Inc.
		 
  
On April 15, 2010, the Board of Trustees approved Lease Agreements between the District and Mobile Modular, Inc. and Williams Scotsman, Inc., respectively, to continue leasing seventy relocatable classrooms until the end of Fiscal Year 2009-2010. These Lease Agreements did not contain any buy-out clause and was therefore a straight lease arrangement from year to year. 
		 
District administration performed a cost benefit analysis of these lease agreements and determined that continued lease of these portables will not be in the best financial welfare of the district. It was further determined that these relocatable classrooms are still needed and school site administrators confirmed that due to the space and educational requirements of their respective sites, these relocatables are projected to be used in the future without a definitive date of removal. 
		 
These relocatable classrooms were first placed in service between 1989 and 2005.  In our financial analysis, continued lease of these portables for the next five years will cost the district $1,823,971.80.   However, the district can opt to purchase these relocatable classrooms now for a negotiated total one time cost of $1,385,688.93.  This action will save the district $438,282.87  in the next five years.  
		 
In addition, there are twenty eight more relocatable classrooms that falls under a previous Lease-Purchase Agreements with insufficient fund balances to fulfill our contract obligations. Administration recommends approving a purchase order of $100,215.45 to cover the remaining balance of the contract which will effectively complete the agreement and ownership of those relocatable classrooms will belong to the district. 
		 
District administration is attaching the report that supports our cost benefit analysis.  
		 
		 
		 
FISCAL IMPACT:
$1,485,904.38
		 
FUNDING SOURCE:
$1,385,688.93 - Capital Facilities (Developer Fees)
$  100,215.45 - Measure G
		 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the purchase of seventy (70) relocatable classrooms from Mobile Modular, Inc. and Williams Scotsman, Inc. listed on the attached report. It is further recommended that the Board of Trustees approve a purchase order to cover the remaining balance of the lease-purchase agreement for the twenty-eight (28) additional relocatable classrooms.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the purchase of seventy (70) relocatable classrooms from Mobile Modular, Inc. and Williams Scotsman, Inc. listed on the attached report. It is further recommended that the Board of Trustees approve a purchase order to cover the remaining balance of the lease-purchase agreement for the twenty-eight (28) additional relocatable classrooms.
items.item_text: Approve Purchase of Ninety-eight (98) Relocatable Classrooms from Mobile Modular, Inc. and Williams Scotsman, Inc. - Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business Services and June Francis Rono, Ph.D., Director of Facilities and Planning
items.item_text_raw: 13.02 Approve Purchase of Ninety-eight (98) Relocatable Classrooms from Mobile Modular, Inc. and Williams Scotsman, Inc. - Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business Services and June Francis Rono, Ph.D., Director of Facilities and Planning

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
			 
Item:  13.03
			 
			 
			 
TO:
Board of Trustees
						 
						 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
						 
						 
PREPARED BY:
Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business Services and June Francis Rono, Ph.D., Director of Facilities and Planning
						 
						 
SUBJECT:
Approve the Lease of Relocatable Classrooms at Various School Sites
			 
  
The East Side Union High School District has been utilizing leased relocatable modular classrooms to provide spaces for educational programs at various school sites. Currently, there are one hundred and eight leased relocatable classrooms throughout the District.  
			 
While several of these relocatable classrooms are being recommended for purchase, there are several that will need to be kept on a lease agreement as it is economically advantageous for the District since removal of those relocatables will take place.  However, there are outstanding invoices that need to be paid to bring these relocatable classroom accounts current.
			 
The fourteen (14) relocatable classrooms at Mt. Pleasant High School will continue to be leased until the classroom modernization projects are completed.  Removal will follow thereafter.  Twenty-four (24) relocatable classrooms at Oak Grove High School will be leased for an additional one year term while the District administration and school principal further determine the necessity of their continued use.  
			 
Approval of leases and/or rental agreements for relocatables classrooms housed at various school sites according to the attached spreadsheet is requested so that the District can continue to pay past and current invoices.
			 
			 
			 
FISCAL IMPACT:
$524,663.58
			 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Capital Facilities (Developer Fees)
			 
			 
			 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the continued lease/rental of these relocatable classrooms located at various District schools according to the attached report.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approved the continued lease/rental of these relocatable classrooms located at various District schools according to the attached report.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  14.06
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business Services
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Accept Warrant Register for the Month of October 2010
	 
Attached is a list of warrants issued during the month of October 2010, in response to Board Policy 3314 Payment for Goods and Services adopted by the Board in May 2009.  The Policy states that, “The Board shall approve all warrants (checks) at a regularly scheduled Board meeting”.   While there is no legal requirement for Board approval of issued warrants, this list and future lists will add to the “transparency” of when the Board approves purchase orders, contracts and other authorized expenses as per Board Policies.
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
	Not Applicable
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
	Not Applicable
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees accept the Warrant register for the month of October 2010
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees accept the warrant register for the month of October 2010
